column1: I have to ask: Have you previously altered any other image or material that’s part of the Archives? https://t.co/H0YFYfHXtv
Update: The young girl and her family are headed to a children’s hospital in the Northeast where doctors had offered to provide charitable care to treat her condition. https://t.co/XRE7i1RHCG

This is an issue that concerns what kind of country we are. It is something I will continue to highlight push for and fight for until this MPP program has ended once and for all and the inhumanity it has generated with it. (8/8)

He has severely undercut our nation's reputation around the world as the country that upholds the highest moral standards. I would ask that the President go to Matamoros take a first-hand look at what he is responsible for and see the inhumanity for himself. (7/8)

For generations the U.S. has been respected around the world as a beacon of moral clarity and moral rectitude. Unfortunately @realDonaldTrump has fundamentally changed that during his presidency. (6/8)

What I came away with is that the President and this entire Administration are forcing people to live in cruel conditions because of the Remain in Mexico policy—no running water where young children (some 1 2 and 3 years old) are living with their parents in squalor. (5/8)

There are times when the river overflows because of heavy rain and they are forced to live and sleep in mud. This is shameful. These are conditions that people legally seeking asylum and refuge in the U.S. should not have to endure. They are human beings. (4/8)

Hundreds if not thousands are living in unspeakable and inhumane conditions right on the other side of the border in Matamoros. Seeing those conditions with our own eyes and walking through the border horrified us all. (3/8)

We had a chance to meet with attorney advocates who have been working in tent courts—the judicial process for considering asylum seekers the Trump Administration has set up. Suffice to say the rule of law is not respected. (2/8)

Today I led a delegation of members from the  @HispanicCaucus to Brownsville TX to look at the effects of the President’s Remain in Mexico policy in Matamoros. I want to thank everyone who came with me to highlight this hugely important issue. This is what we found: (1/8) https://t.co/oolTuQsCNx

Just left the border.   We were able to get a young girl with a heart defect and Down’s Syndrome allowed into the United States with her family while their asylum claim is considered.  She had been denied yesterday. #DemsAtTheBorder

I’d be glad to talk to y’all about the delegation’s visit and everything we see although it will have to be after tmrw because I have to get back to San Antonio after Matamoros. https://t.co/NCKzFmK7U9
Just got to Brownsville to go see the effects of Donald Trump’s Remain in Mexico policy tomorrow in Matamoros.

Today @RepSylviaGarcia & I sent a letter to @GregAbbott_TX demanding that he reverse his disgraceful refugee resettlement decision. Texas has long opened its doors to refugees & both political parties have supported this program.  He is hurting our state. https://t.co/vUHwmF5qmP
.@USGAO an independent nonpartisan watchdog confirmed what we already know: President Trump abused his power for his own personal and political gain. https://t.co/vv8LOf53sd

Parnas is facing federal indictment. But so are most of the people on @realDonaldTrump's team. That's the company he keeps.   Parnas' interview confirmed all the public testimony from multiple nonpartisan public servants.  We need answers from @senatemajldr not secrets.

To Tamil Texans and those celebrating around the world this week best wishes for a joyous fruitful Thai Pongal! This season may the harvest festival bring with it peace and prosperity for you and your family. இனிய தை பொங்கல் நல்வாழ்த்துக்கள்

A State Dept. official calls it “insane” and “deeply chilling” that Trump cronies were possibly surveilling Ambassador Marie Yovanovitch. And it is.  I look forward to working with Chairman Engel and my colleagues on @HouseForeign to investigate these deeply disturbing charges. https://t.co/1RdJm2D2Xo

This new evidence from our investigation at @HouseIntel affirms @realDonaldTrump & his associates’ efforts to apply pressure on President Zelensky to investigate the Bidens. It also affirms our decision to impeach the President. I urge the Senate to take it very seriously. https://t.co/CVIm9CTQRQ

Vladimir Putin is demonstrating what dictators do by undermining any remnants of accountability in Russia. We must take care to never normalize President Trump’s adoration of Putin and his way of rule. https://t.co/W0v0Jov1rO

There’s been deep corruption among Texas’ state leadership — huge no bid contracts pay-to-play politics sweetheart deals for cronies that made them rich.   Should the federal government stop sending money to Texas because of that? Or is it just Puerto Rico? https://t.co/A9vJPDXo56

Puerto Rico still recovering from Hurricane Maria has been devastated by recent earthquakes.  People have died. Medicine food and water are hard to come by. Many are fighting to survive.  Yet President Trump is holding back billions in aid.   Release the aid for Puerto Rico! https://t.co/oyOo94qVTV

This is (one reason) why I voted against the DHS/Defense appropriations bill — there was no transfer restriction in the bill to prevent President Trump from stealing billions from other accounts to fund his border wall.   And that’s exactly what he’s doing now. https://t.co/UfgKfdx1Zh

I want to thank former deputy National Security Advisor Avril Haines @CFR_org President @RichardHaass and former National Security Advisor Stephen Hadley for testifying.  That said my colleagues and I still expect to hear from @SecPompeo promptly. (2/2)

In today's @HouseForeign hearing we are making sense of the chaos that @realdonaldtrump created in Iraq. We extended an invite to @SecPompeo who unacceptably refused to testify. He has an obligation to the American people to shed light on the Administration’s actions. (1/2) https://t.co/2rl8QuhWgO

@ksatnews @AFLCIO These are some of the reasons I cannot support the further expansion of collective bargaining specifically for police unions across the country. Not until the disciplinary process is fixed and bad officers are properly held accountable.
@ksatnews I also believe the umbrella unions such as the @AFLCIO have a responsibility to speak up to help change this.
@ksatnews Police unions too often stand by bad officers regardless of how bad they’ve acted. It severely undermines public trust.

.@ksatnews airing an important report  “Broken Blue” right now on serious problems with policing in San Antonio.   For example one police officer gave a feces sandwich to a homeless man was fired appealed got his job back.
Congratulations to @iingwen on her successful re-election and to the Taiwanese people for demonstrating Taiwan’s vibrant democracy a true example for the world. https://t.co/9nKn7GqfXk

I ask the faith community in Texas that resettled so many refugees over the years to speak up in unambiguous terms.  I challenge Texas pastors who sponsor missions to help vulnerable people around the world to speak up.
This is a disgraceful move by Texas Governor Greg Abbott. He has completely submitted to bigotry and xenophobia. https://t.co/gbmtHWksId
(2/2) The PFAS Action Act would require the @EPA to: ✅ Stem the flow of PFAS contamination into the environment  ✅ Identify health risk associated with PFAS  ✅ Limit human exposure to PFAS

(1/2) Today I voted for a bill that will meaningfully address PFAS chemicals linked to several adverse health effects that have been detected in soil surface water and ground water across San Antonio Texas and the entire U.S.  https://t.co/oLNgH48wLZ

This is a serious moment in our country. Every American owes a debt of gratitude to our military for its sacrifice. For that reason a decision that risks troops’ wellbeing must only be made thoughtfully & with the informed consent of the public and this Congress. @HouseForeign https://t.co/pr6UOT5Ej2

We paid our respects this week to Army Veteran Ronnie Dutton who was laid to rest at Ft. Sam Houston National Cemetery. Specialist Dutton served his country from 1968-1970 with heroism and self-sacrifice. @VANatCemeteries https://t.co/hgVGXwI6Ug

The National Environmental Policy Act signed by a Republican President requires environmental oversight on major federal projects. This Admin cannot wave this legal requirement and this proposed rule will ultimately be struck down by the courts.  https://t.co/SQBfdZ1qnU
The beard stays (for now)! https://t.co/h761TTpM8d https://t.co/Fghl7cJsmC

I spoke with Ambassador Espina on Dec 30. He said the Guatemalan government would wait for president-elect Giammattei's inauguration on 1/14 before making any expansion to the deal to include Mexicans.  I’m troubled DHS confirmed the expansion. This will only endanger families. https://t.co/fCJiOKlBxm
Praying that our troops remain safe. https://t.co/DQtbAAClMh

Puerto Rico has suffered immensely. But its people are strong. That said the federal government needs to be a leader for all of our citizens. It's our responsibility to step in and ensure our Puerto Rican brothers and sisters are not left behind.  https://t.co/6WYuqzlIeK

Throughout the impeachment investigation President Trump obstructed Congress by unlawfully blocking witnesses from testifying. For the sake of our Constitution there needs to be a just and fair trial in the Senate. The truth must be set free. https://t.co/6ESVJGN3rm

When @realDonaldTrump pulled the U.S. out of the Iran nuclear agreement he promised he’d get us a “better deal.”  Instead he’s only pushed us closer to conflict and Iran even closer to nuclear weapons. https://t.co/J6p1LytrA7

There’s the old adage in politics that you trust but verify. But @realDonaldTrump has told thousands of lies. So with this Administration we have to verify and then perhaps trust. Congress needs to see what intelligence they used to make this decision.  https://t.co/lVcrEj2S9A
